website_summaries.verdict: While its reception is generally good or better than advertised, no mast is included. Performance is on par w/lower-priced antennas.
pros: Unit can be partially disassembled to fit tight access hatches like the attic
Holds up well in heavy weather
Reception is good even without amplifier

customer_reviews.title: BUYER BEWARE
customer_reviews.text: I purchased an amazon less expensive antenna and I could only pull in 38 stations.So I purchased the most expensive one thinking I could reach out further.It advertised 80 mile range. SURPRISE..My cheaper antenna worked better than this one.I returned it immediately.Thank you Amazon for standing behind your merchandise...
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: if you build it they will come
customer_reviews.text: antennaweb.org said I was not suppose to get any (0) channels, I live 70 miles due north of Mobile, AL, 90 miles North E of Pensacola, FL.......IN the woods, big time........ I am currently receiving 18 HD channels, all of my local networks, PBS, TBN,weather channel, food cooking, child program and others. I went through 2 other local walmart types got 3 or 4.....I went to my local, muffler shop bough 3 sticks of muffler tube had the guy swell the joints 3 sints 21', built a floor mount to slid muffler pepe into floor mount used u bolts attached to a gable end. Mounting u bolts comes with antenna,,,,,,,,,,,super easy to assemble the antenna,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,good by direct tv
customer_reviews.author: James Kevin Moree

customer_reviews.title: Performance questionable
customer_reviews.text: Had to return it. I have a off brand 4 bay in my attic and was looking to improve signal strength with this CM 8 bay. I had an older CM 8 bay years ago and worked well. This newer version is cheaply made. Even with moving outdoors 25 ft off the ground with an antenna twice the size of the 4 bay in the attic, this CM performed much worse. The 80 mile range is a joke. I am less than 35 miles from most of the main towers. Overall signal dropped 25% instead of improving. Went back to Amazon today.
customer_reviews.author: Simpleton

customer_reviews.title: Great product for outdoor antenna
customer_reviews.text: We are a little over 40 miles from most transmitters. I tried a couple of smaller outdoor antennas that were about $40 and, after many fruitless trips up and down the ladder I had to give up. I was missing several key channels even though they said they worked "up to 150 miles." Then I put this one up and received more channels than ever (55). Most will never be used but we definitely get the ones we want. This is built well but easy to manage. I had to carry it up a 24 foot extension ladder but it was not a problem.
customer_reviews.author: Robert C. Mehl

customer_reviews.title: the antenna stayed in its box for some time, ...
customer_reviews.text: the antenna stayed in its box for some time, until yesterday when I went to install it and found out that amazon posted false information about what all signals it could get. This is NOT a vhf uhf fm ant. according to channel master it is only a uhf hd antenna. so I am out 100.00 seen as how the return window closed already, and will have to shop elsewhere for a true vhf uhf antenna
customer_reviews.author: Leslie N. Cushman

customer_reviews.title: Low VHF gain
customer_reviews.text: I am about 60 miles from Atlanta broadcast towers in Athens, GA. Used this to replace my old AntennaCraft HBU 55 which never got FOX very well. CM4228HD gets ABC, CBS, FOX, CW, and some others very well, but NBC and PBS are gone. Have tried Pre-amp and retrofit VHF antenna with no success. When looking at your channel report on TVFool, pay attention to type of signal for the channels you want. This antenna is not designed to pick up VHF.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: It's UHF-Only, and some DTV stations are on VHF
customer_reviews.text: I gave it only three stars mainly because the product description is a mite misleading. This is a "UHF HDTV Antenna," *not* a "UHF and HDTV Antenna." The latter implies it will receive *all* HDTV broadcast stations. Some digital TV stations are in the VHF bands, and this antenna is a UHF antenna. It'll probably catch VHF signals "well enough" if the stations are close enough, but if they're at all distant: No go. As a UHF-only antenna it's probably quite nice. Construction seems solid. Assembly and attachment to a mast are easy enough. Coax attachment is a bit finicky if you're using the longer compression F-connectors on your coax, due to mechanical clearance, but that's a relatively minor issue.
customer_reviews.author: Jim

customer_reviews.title: Phenomenal
customer_reviews.text: Replaced our outdated antenna and burned out rotor with the Channel Master CM-4228HD High VHF, UHF and HDTV Antenna and Winegard low noise amp. With the old set up most of the channels we received would pixel-ate at any given time depending on weather patterns, etc. After unpacking and doing very minor assembly, attached the antenna and amp to a 20' pole and attached it to the soffit of the house. Ran a channel search and it found a total of 57 channels. Most all are crystal clear and most do not suffer any pix-elation. The cost of the whole assembly is little more than a month subscription of satellite tv. Very happy with purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Burtonman

customer_reviews.title: Don't waste your money
customer_reviews.text: Don't waste your money. This antenna works worse than lower cost antennas. I tried the 1byone 70 mile antenna first and it did okay and picking up signals but the signals were rather unstable and would cause lots of pixelation. Then I tried this antenna and while the signal was very stable, it was not as strong and did not pick up as many stations as the 1byone. Lastly I tried the GE 29884 Pro Outdoor/Attic Mount Antenna. This antenna is a good combination of the previous two. Good strong and solid reception. And it was less than half the cost of this antenna.
customer_reviews.author: steelhorse

customer_reviews.title: Somewhat disappointed. Reception not as good as we hoped.
customer_reviews.text: We purchased this antenna because ours was awful. Weather conditions had to be pristine and the antenna spot on in it's direction. Weather rarely cooperates that way. This one is better but if it's cloudy and/or windy we still can't get a channel in from less than 30 miles away. It's a little better than the old one but we thought it would be no problem to pick up a station so close. As a sidenote, when it arrived the box was open. Nothing seemed damaged. I hope we got a new one and not used one or one switched out of its original box.
customer_reviews.author: Mary K

customer_reviews.title: I now receive 42 local channels
customer_reviews.text: This antenna is the antenna to beat all antennas for the price. Before purchasing this antenna, I was only able to pick up six local channels 35 miles from the nearest major city. After installing the antenna, though, I was able to receive 42 channels and immediately called my cable TV provider to tell them, "Goodbye!". The antenna is very lightweight, yet, durable enough for my outdoor roof mount, too. Its design is sleek and provides for optimal reception with no interference. I wasn't expecting the results I received due to numerous trees surrounding my home. But, this antenna is the real deal and I highly recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: ScottLanter

customer_reviews.title: This antenna is great. I tried some interior ones first with poor
customer_reviews.text: This antenna is great. I tried some interior ones first with poor results, so I ordered this one. I used it indoors for a couple of days by leaning it up against a wall and it was an order of magnitude better than the interior ones. Once I got it installed outdoors it really shined. It is relatively light so pretty easy to install. I highly recommend that you purchase it with the Channel Master pre-amp however. You don't want to lose your signal in feed line losses from your antenna to your TVs. I wouldn't hesitate to recommend this to anyone.
customer_reviews.author: Aaron

customer_reviews.title: Works great...
customer_reviews.text: All that you need to mount a 20 foot mast. I used two ten foot sections hurricane fence tubing. The ones that go on top of the fencing and have the male and female ends. I also found a coupler that gives the union more rigidity. I also added a pair of stainless steel clamps. I used the Channel Master CM-4228HD High VHF, UHF and HDTV Antenna. I also installed a Winegard LNA-200 Boost XT HDTV Preamplifier, TV Antenna Amplifier Signal Booster. This setup pulls in stations from about 70 miles away. I am able to to supply 7 television sets just fine. One of these is in my shop with about 150 feet R6 coax.
customer_reviews.author: venharis

customer_reviews.title: Not good for an attic install.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this antenna to replace an older Winegard HD-9095P long range Yagi. I was hoping to free up some attic space with this antenna. But to my disappointment, this antenna fell far short in performance compared to the older Winegard HD-9095P which is much larger in size. My 21 stations from the Winegard HD-9095P fell down to 10 with this ChannelMaster model. I swapped the antennas into the same space in the attic and pointed them in the same direction. So that was not an issue with the comparison. But it may do good for some when mounted outside.
customer_reviews.author: Dallas419

customer_reviews.title: Couldn't be happier.
customer_reviews.text: I am loving this antenna but not as much as I am loving that I don't have to pay the big cable bill any longer. I picked up 49 channels when we first hooked it up. Many we eliminated because they were not of interest or duplicates of others. I get great HD pictures from all channels, much better than what I was getting from cable.
customer_reviews.author: Carolyn PonteTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Getting 28 channels inside the Cherokee national forest
customer_reviews.text: We wanted to cut our directv bill due to paying over $100 a month (with 2 dvrs and smallest package). I've talked to several people that have cut the cord from cable and was hesitant to pursue due to our location. We are in a valley on the top of a mountain. I first tried mounting it in the attic, but only got 5 channels. It was picking up channels while it laid on it's side. My husband decided to mount it on the pole our directv was located and we got crystal clear reception of 28 channels. Yippee, I am amazed and would highly recommend this antenna.
customer_reviews.author: Diana M. Smith

customer_reviews.title: pulls in signals quite well
customer_reviews.text: I was using a GE antenna pro which is a small yagi style antenna. It was doing good bringing in 15 channels but a few would drop out depending on the day. I installed an amplifier but not much help. I purchased the Channel Master CM-4228HD and mounted it in place of the GE. Not too impressed, 12 channels at the most. I moved the antenna about 10 feet to the east and rescanned the tv, and wow pulled in 23 channels the furthest tower from Canada at 88 miles. I tested the GE antenna in the the same position as the channel master but still only 15 channels. I am very happy with my purchase.
customer_reviews.author: cathysteve

customer_reviews.title: Closer channels (29 miles out) are obstructed by trees and hilly terrain and when pointed in that direction several channels com
customer_reviews.text: Acquired this for remote antenna set-up. Picks up channels 53 miles out (not much obstruction). Closer channels (29 miles out) are obstructed by trees and hilly terrain and when pointed in that direction several channels come in pretty good, but not all. Installed on elevated 20-ft mast. Overall happy. Acquired HD 4228 also (reported 75 mile plus range) trying to pick up Fox, which was intermittent with HD 4221, but that didn't help. I installed LN-200 in-line pre-amp also. (Would recommend Channel Master 7777, higher gain next time.) My advice is to acquire the cheaper of the the two, you'll save money (about half) with no recognizable upward benefit for the more expensive antenna.
customer_reviews.author: AKRANGER

customer_reviews.title: Waste of money
customer_reviews.text: I only received one major network and several minor ones with this antenna. I live 30 miles from the signals. This was well inside the range of this antenna. A house one mile down the road from us has an antenna and picks up every major network and channel available in the area. I upgraded to a larger antenna thinking that it might help. It didn’t. I only picked up a few more minor channel networks. Very disappointed. Bought a signal amplifier from Channel Master as well thinking it might help. It didn’t.
customer_reviews.author: y82ws6

customer_reviews.title: Great performance even when installed in the attic.
customer_reviews.text: Did not expect to receive many channels when I installed it in my attic but was only hoping to catch the 3 local channels for news. Aligned it at 310 degrees for best reception in my area, and it works great, I can catch 26 channels, some more than 150 miles away. Definitely worth the money. I had a large rooftop antenna 20 years ago and it only caught 10 channels so I am very happy with the performance of the CM-4228HD.
customer_reviews.author: ezseeker

customer_reviews.title: ... every direction possible and still unable to get a better picture than a 10 dollar rabbit ear on top ...
customer_reviews.text: Bought it a new cable a booster the works even mounted it 20 ft higher turned it every direction possible and still unable to get a better picture than a 10 dollar rabbit ear on top of TV.
customer_reviews.author: Kristy I. Schantin

customer_reviews.title: Amazing HD quality TV - Cablecutter
customer_reviews.text: I live 78 miles away from the towers, never thought I'd be able to see local television. I placed this in my attic at an exterior wall and am amazed that I'm able to get all of the major local channels in HD quality. Installation was easy, plug in cable to antenna and TV. Hardest part was routing the cable. Pays for itself in less than 2 months of paying for cable to get these same channels. I'm now officially a cable cutter.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Chinese garbage
customer_reviews.text: Channel Master is not the quality it used to be. I got better reception with a Mohu Leaf! I returned this.
customer_reviews.author: S. Firestone

customer_reviews.title: Terrible product. I will be sending it back
customer_reviews.text: I couldn't get but 3 out of 22 stations in my area with this mounted at about 40ft. high on top of my roof. I tried it with a booster and without to no avail. I don't know if there is something wrong with this particular one but it didn't work at all. And I'm only 15 miles from all the towers. Terrible product. I will be sending it back.
customer_reviews.author: Mary E. Smits

customer_reviews.title: Live about 30 miles west of Ft. Worth Texas ...
customer_reviews.text: Live about 30 miles west of Ft. Worth Texas...about 60 miles from Dallas. Put the antenna up about 25 feet off the ground facing due east with lots of trees in my back yard. I get 55 channels. Cut the cable. Can't believe I'm getting 55 channels. And noticed yesterday in a rain storm...at the gym all the cable channels were blacked out...came home and my channels were up. I've noticed that stuff is not quite a clear as cable...so I have some work to do. It may be my cable from the antenna or maybe the internal setting on my TV...so working to resolve. With this antenna and steaming why would anyone pay AT&T for cable.
customer_reviews.author: Chuck Estes

customer_reviews.title: Beware of trees
customer_reviews.text: I live around 45 miles from most of the main Seattle stations. The only trouble is that there are a lot of trees and hilly terrain. I did not get any more channels than I had with a small UHF/VHF antenna that cost about $30. I returned it, which went great, and luckily found out about Locast. They had just started service in the Seattle area, so now I have my locals, and then I subscribed to Netflix and said good bye to satellite. I have no doubt that this antenna would work well if you had more "line of sight" to your stations.
customer_reviews.author: gjaykin

customer_reviews.title: Great reception
customer_reviews.text: Antenna works as advertised, tv network towers were about 60 miles away. We went from receiving 14 clear channels to now getting 36 non duplicate channels. Reception is great and picture is better quality than our previous non-digital antenna (traditional long outdoor)antenna. Installation was easy with supplied hardware to an existing pole. I may try an inline amplifier from channel master in the future, but for now we are happy with the selection of channels we are receiving. We used tvfool and antenna web to align the antenna, the best they showed us receiving was 19 channels.
customer_reviews.author: Cedar Creek

customer_reviews.title: nice equipment and simple to install
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my father in law for fathers day. climbed his current tv antenna and mounted it to the top. Ran new coax, bought a booster and then re-scanned all of his tvs. He has four tvs and prior to this antenna, he could get all tvs to have reception, but it was choppy and would fade in and out. With this antenna and new booster, all the tvs stay in signal and can all be on at the same time.
customer_reviews.author: dogpile

customer_reviews.title: My non-working chimney was an excellent anchor for the mast
customer_reviews.text: I recently had the antenna installed on my second story roof. My non-working chimney was an excellent anchor for the mast. I had two cables installed and used a splitter. The reception for all the channels is rather exceptional. The pictures are very sharp and crisp and much better than cable. Cable has too many compression issues. I live in Memphis and able to pick-up all the local stations and about 15 other stations. I have finally dumped cable and save over $70.00 month. With Netflix and Hulu I have all that I need.
customer_reviews.author: JRP

customer_reviews.title: I live 30+ miles away from the transmitter, tucked ...
customer_reviews.text: I live 30+ miles away from the transmitter, tucked up against a hill with no line of sight, hill at least 60+ft above my roof line, and another hill between the transmitter and me with only a small gap. I tried a dipole before and barely got signal at ground level, with this I was above 50%. In my attic, I am over 80, and with an amp over 90. Having all the mounting hardware included is a plus.
customer_reviews.author: Morgan Collins

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic antenna with smaller profile than the directional versions
customer_reviews.text: Fantastic antenna. Modified the CM mount to bolt into old satillite footplate. No need for amplifier as I as very close to the antennas. Picked up 124 channels, 114 of which I've never heard of, but fantastic signal and SNR on the major locals. Can't wait to hook it up to my recast. I am currently streaming locals on my fire TVs with a paid app, but will explore this once
customer_reviews.author: feldme

customer_reviews.title: Terrible, only brought in 1 station
customer_reviews.text: Seems like TV antennas are very site specific - one that works great for someone is terrible for another and visa versa. For me, this antenna was terrible - it only brought in 1 station, the same as a simple flimsy indoor antenna. I mounted it on the roof and raised the mast 4 feet. Still no go. The Antop antenna I bought brings in 5 stations, where 3-4 of them are viewable at any time. This one is going back.
customer_reviews.author: Robl

customer_reviews.title: Great picture...I cut the cord with Cox Cable and get all local channels with this antenna
customer_reviews.text: I installed this Channel Master Extremetenna in my new home in the SE Phoenix area. I added a powered splitter and use this single antenna for 4 different large flat panel TVs. It receives a very large number of channels and the picture quality for the HD channels is superior to even the COX Cable quality! I installed it in my attic which is standard wood truss, but has very thick sprayed insulation above with concrete tile on the roof. I aimed the antenna towards the hill with the majority of the broadcast towers in our area. I actually receive far more channels than I had anticipated. I couldn't be more happy with this antenna.
customer_reviews.author: Todd in AZ

customer_reviews.title: Works pretty well - 40 mile range.
customer_reviews.text: They always exagerate the range on these types of antennas. They say it will reach out to 80 miles, but mine only got channels withing 40 miles. The channels 40-80 miles out were unreacheable. That was far enough though to get 5 channels from the middle of the woods. I only put mine about 15 feet in the air. Possibly it would reach farther if you put it 30-40 feet up. Reception of the channels I could get was great and in high definition - 1080i - so it does work fine.
customer_reviews.author: GamePlayer

customer_reviews.title: Very nice antenna
customer_reviews.text: I put it in my attic, receives all local channels perfectly, furthest is about 50 miles, I believe. Appears to be very well made, was easy to install, comes in a big box mostly assembled, just kind of pops open, few little nuts to tighten and you are good to go. It replaced a long yagi type antenna that was too directional, I couldn't get it aimed to receive all the local channels at once. I just pointed this one in the general direction of The Big City and no further adjusting was necessary.
customer_reviews.author: Anony Moose

customer_reviews.title: Mileage not a good indicator
customer_reviews.text: Installed at a height of 15ft outdoors and was able to get stations with no dropout that have a signal strength of -58dbm (30 mile dist) according to TV Fool. The dbm reading from TV fool is a better indicator for the possibility of getting enough signal without drop out. Mileage is not a very good indicator to determine if the antenna will be able to pick up stations since other factors such as terrain and the station output power are varied. Stations with signal strength less than -60dbm may experience drop out or worse.
customer_reviews.author: NManitou

customer_reviews.title: Strong antenna. Best so far.
customer_reviews.text: This antenna rocks. I had previously purchased a different HD antenna from Channel Master (CM 2020) without having read the reviews. Initially it was fine and everything but my local ABC station came in clear and solid. But my wife watches Good Morning America and she was tired of the choppiness so I needed to find a solution. Tried it in my attic first and then mounted outside. Still no improvement. After reading about the Gray Hoverman-style antenna I found this one (CM 4228). Hooked it up in my attic and it works like a champ. All the major network affiliates are crystal clear! I certainly do love not paying for cable TV.
customer_reviews.author: rugarrr

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: This antenna looks great. It is big. It looks like it is well-made. I had great expectations. I hooked it up with the hope of getting more channels than with my 5 year old $50 antenna. What a huge disappointment. It wouldn't even get as many channels as the cheap antenna. I could have spent more to get a preamp, but I don't think it would be any better that just replacing my $50 antenna. Sending it back for a refund.
customer_reviews.author: MC

customer_reviews.title: Great attic antenna for suburban viewing.
customer_reviews.text: I live about 17 miles from the location of TV towers in my area. Fortunately most that I like are in the same location. I installed this in my attic facing out a gable wall made with 2X4 studs, 1" wood boards and cedar shingles. The path to the TV towers has some trees and a slight rise hill. I have about 70 ft of coax with a 3 way splitter going to 3 TVs. No amplifier was installed. I got 40+ stations that come in quite well, including two PBS stations that are on a low VHF band. I am very pleased with this antenna and highly recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Stretch

customer_reviews.title: Channel Master CM-4228HD High VHF, UHF and HDTV Antenna
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this compact outdoor to replace one of those 12 inch square types you put in a window or hang on the wall.The improvement was great as expected.Will never use those hang on the window or wall antenna again.This is a good quality antenna.One thing though I Put this antenna outside on the chimney on a pole.I also bought a $40. GE pro attic mount #29884 antenna and put it in the attic for another TV.The one cheaper one in the attic pulls in more channels and has stronger signal.Both Antenna pointing in the same direction.Go figure? If I bought another digital antenna I would purchase the GE at half the price.
customer_reviews.author: Thunderdog

customer_reviews.title: Bigger than expected, but it works.
customer_reviews.text: I ordered and returned 2 other antennas because they did not receive any signal from the towers 30 - 40 miles away. This is despite the claim of an 85 mile range (1byone 85 Miles Digital Amplified Outdoor / Attic / Roof HDTV Antenna with VHF and UHF Band and Mounting Pole, Extremely High Performance) and a 60 mile range (4 Element Bowtie Indoor/Outdoor HDTV Antenna - 60 Mile Range Antennas Direct). The Channel Master CM-4228 worked. It brought in the signals I wanted. Only trouble is that it was bigger than described and would not fit through my attic access, hence the loss of 1 star. Be aware - this antenna is BIG.
customer_reviews.author: Family Jewels

customer_reviews.title: This is the antenna to get if you live 50+ miles from station!
customer_reviews.text: I have gone through three antennas to try to get my signal dialed in. The last and most expensive was the Winegard HD8200u, it was a joke as was their service. This antenna was incredibly easy to setup and install, and it is quite compact compared to other antennas. I live in a valley that is between 51 and 56 miles away from my stations, and it works flawlessly with a preamplifier. I have 27 channels with beautiful pictures. If you live in a rural setting with hills and vegetation around you then this is your antenna.
customer_reviews.author: Striper Guy

customer_reviews.title: Works great.
customer_reviews.text: I installed the CM-4221 antenna at about 10' on an old Dish antenna mount using the same coax cabling. I also installed a Channel Master Titan 2 CM-7778 (medium gain) preamplifier. I have no problems getting 3 channels 13 miles away at a compass angle of 105 degrees (about east) and 6 channels 33 miles away at an angle of 185 degrees (south). Overall I'm very happy with the setup and performance.
customer_reviews.author: Tom Crites

customer_reviews.title: It works
customer_reviews.text: Good quality TV antenna. On the large side for an attic. The reception is fantastic. The only antenna I have tried that outperforms my 50 year old analog rooftop antenna. Picks up UHF and VHF signals across a 180 degree swath of the horizon. If your local broadcast towers are spread out across a wide area this is the one you want. If they are all within a degree or two of each other, you might do better with a more directional antenna.
customer_reviews.author: The Davinator

customer_reviews.title: Super easy to put up
customer_reviews.text: this is for the Channel Master CM-4228HD High VHF, UHF and HDTV Antenna version. I live in a fairly fringe area (purple to white) and have 3 different towers to get signal from, i've been struggling for years trying to get all my locals, this antenna, stuck up on the pole, 8 feet off the ground, grabs channels i didn't know were there, went from 19 channels scanned to 39 channels. it is amazing. this is day one with this antenna. I recommend. I do have a pre-amp on the coax with a moca filter and lightning protection.
customer_reviews.author: Ken Compton

customer_reviews.title: Watching ALL channels in Seminole, FL
customer_reviews.text: Living in Seminole (Walsingham Park), Florida, signal reception can be dicey due to trees. The CM-4228HD is installed on a 30 foot pole and pointed due East. Reception is great from channel 3.1 to 66.x. We're also getting Sarasota's ABC affiliate. The materials used are stout-looking and the signal connections (the RF combiner) for the two main arrays are solid metal. Around here, anything to fight the UV rays is welcome.
customer_reviews.author: B Cumbers

customer_reviews.title: Best I ever try
customer_reviews.text: I don't like to write reviews unless I am totally certain about the product. I want to start saying that I leave on a forest pretty much, just around my house I have 10 trees around my house not more that 10 feet from it and then several more around. I have try several antenas with no success, but this one has worked like a charm, i still added some signal boosters as the receive signal is pretty weak from all those trees stopping it. But definitely is tge best I ever try.
customer_reviews.author: DarkLion

customer_reviews.title: CM4228HD antenna
customer_reviews.text: Antenna well constructed and easy setup. I live in a bad area and so far I have not found an antenna that brings i the stations I most desire which are 50-80 miles away and many hills and trees in the way. Channel Master help line suggested a directional antenna such as the CM 3020 which was my next choice and will probably try, getting frustrated and can only put 20 -25 feet in air because of size and weight of these better antennae.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: This is UHF only
customer_reviews.text: I bought this because we live about 40 miles from the TV transmitters. My previous antenna was not designed for that distance. With this antenna installed I got several stations. I did not get our local PBS station. When I contacted them, they told me they broadcast in VHF unlike the others in our area. This antenna does not receive VHF signals. Back to the drawing board. The signals does break up sometimes with this antenna. We have many trees and uneven terrain in our location. Generally, the signal is clear and sometimes better than it was with satellite.
customer_reviews.author: Rob S.

customer_reviews.title: WOW!!!
customer_reviews.text: Picked up a channel master extremetenna four 30' coaxial cables and a PCT 8 channel amp. The unit worked great, with this setup I'm able to pull in 38 channels on 3 TV's and 39 on the last one (older TV don't know if that is a factor for the extra channel). Everything cost me one month of cable bill. Bye cable bill!!!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: 2 mountain ranges in between two large bodies of water our topography is the worst in the country
customer_reviews.text: As Chief Engineer of a TV station in the 12th Largest market in the US with nine major hills, 2 mountain ranges in between two large bodies of water our topography is the worst in the country. This antenna was/is my goto for folks while we rolled into the DTV Realm ant with its streamlined looks it’s easily my no fail shotgun approach. If you amplify a garbage signal it is just a louder garbage signal. You need a real antenna to pull down the whole market. Put it in your attic.
customer_reviews.author: John Barrett

customer_reviews.title: Was recommended by CM installer on youtube
customer_reviews.text: Actually does work were 6 others I installed would/could not. Highly recommend this seller, he knows what he is talking about. The cheap space gun looking Chinese crap with the remote control? Run. They work for about 2 months before the gears in the housing go out. This one from Chanel Master helped me go from 0-1 channels..3 on a good day, to 15 channels. This is out in the sticks at a lake house where mobile phones do not work either. Highly recommend this one.
customer_reviews.author: Donny Rutherford

customer_reviews.title: These are Great Antenna's
customer_reviews.text: I really love these Antenna's... I have 2 of them facing in slightly different directions. They work great. Channel Master is the best Antenna's on the market and they have Great Tech Support and Willing to help. I highly Recommend these/
customer_reviews.author: John Campbell

customer_reviews.title: Partial review - Indoor testing only
customer_reviews.text: Partial review (I have yet to mount it outside on pole). Indoors, it only works as well as (actually a little worse than) than the NoCable 50 indoor antenna (which I'm impressed with and highly recommend for indoor use). Indoor, It picks up stations 13 miles away with a mountain blocking line of sight, but not one 18 miles away with a mountain in line of sight. It's easy to assemble, it's about 3' x 4', weighs about 10# and comes with the U-bolts for mounting to pole.
customer_reviews.author: rewilliams21

customer_reviews.title: Great Antenna. I live in a bowl and can ...
customer_reviews.text: Great Antenna. I live in a bowl and can pick up 29 stations off the front and back of the antenna, no rotor required. Signal on all stations are rock solid. We cut the cord 2 years ago and broadcast TV, Netflix, Hulu, Amazon Prime and Tablo, satisfying all of our entertainment needs for less then $30 a month. We prefer the programming we have to satellite, and save $85 a month. We will never go back to Satellite or cable.
customer_reviews.author: Tom in Colfax

customer_reviews.title: did not work
customer_reviews.text: This antenna did not work any better than a 50 year old antenna that was here when i purchased my home I live 32 miles from the towers I want to pick up. The old antenna works as good as this one. It is made cheap and looks it. Not worth the price.
customer_reviews.author: Butch Crum

customer_reviews.title: Not for me
customer_reviews.text: Before trying this, I've been using a much smaller Mediasonic HOMEWORX HDTV Outdoor Antenna. And the Mediasonic has worked well for me. However, I wanted to see whether I could do even "better" with a much bigger stronger antenna, that has a wider radius. This Channel Master CM4228HD failed to perform as well as the smaller and cheaper Mediasonic. I expected an antenna with 75+ mile range, to perform as well or better than an antenna with just 40 mile range. I returned this Channel Master CM4228HD the same day I received it. I will stick with my Mediasonic HOMEWORX HDTV Outdoor Antenna. I'm just amazed a smaller and cheaper antenna outperformed this one.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: A great antenna - even mounted in the attic
customer_reviews.text: This antenna was an important piece of the cable-cutting plan. I have it sitting in the attic, feeding an HDHomeRun OTA network tuner, with playback through Amazon FireTV sticks at each TV. Channels all come in perfectly clear and without any issues. Note: Channel Master makes a smaller version in this same series, but since I wanted it in the attic rather than outside, I upsized a bit just to be safe. I do not regret that decision at all.
customer_reviews.author: Camelot One

customer_reviews.title: Superior Antenna
customer_reviews.text: I live approximately 30 miles from local transmitters. The reception is outstanding especially HD. As pictured, the antenna sits atop a 17’ pole. The antenna itself was easy to install and align using the alignment guide on the Channel Master web site. Currently receiving 42 channels from a fixed antenna location. This antenna does the job.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas J.

customer_reviews.title: Very good antenna!
customer_reviews.text: This brings in all of the channels that I expected it to even though I have not mounted it correctly yet. I put this on a 5 foot pole stood in the yard for testing and despite a lot of trees and bushes it surprised me with great reception. I do intend to mount it correctly but to be honest it works much better than it should just where it is.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Incredible Antenna!
customer_reviews.text: This antenna totally kicks ass! I had a really good Wineguard, but I occasionally had some pixelation. Now have an incredible picture and even more channels too! I live 44 miles from the broadcast towers and this 80 mile Channel Master antenna with my already installed Channel Master signal boosters, I am in disbelief how Crystal clear my picture is! I very much recommend this product!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Long range reliable signal
customer_reviews.text: Small size light weight. Live 100 miles from nearest station outperforms channel master ultra high digital cross fire. Holds the signals steady durring bad weather. Only dislike and I blame the transmitting stations is with this fenacky nitpicking digital signal is the need for twice the height, which makes installation on a 50 feet tall tower extremely dangerous. In the analogue days just above the roof did the job. But it pulls in stations over 200 miles on a regular basis reviving 62 channels
customer_reviews.author: John blanton

customer_reviews.title: Finally An Antenna That Works
customer_reviews.text: Previously, I purchased two electronic high tech (allegedly) antennas from Amazon. they came with signal amplifiers, and a rotating antenna for maximum performance. Both failed within a week of installation. I then purchased the Channel Master antenna which was easy to assemble and install. The antenna pulls in more stations than the previous 2 without any signal amplification. Does a great job. Hi def programs awesome.
customer_reviews.author: Anon

customer_reviews.title: Maybe it will be better when the leaf's are off the trees
customer_reviews.text: Maybe it will be better when the leaf's are off the trees, but for now it gets some stations, its doesn't seem to get 180 degrees recpt, I also have a booster channel master so I don't know if it work better in winter more than summer
customer_reviews.author: Paul D. Payne

customer_reviews.title: Gave me less stations than my $35 antenna
customer_reviews.text: I installed this correctly and re-scanned my TV. I went from 42 stations to 27. I put back my $35 antenna, re-scanned again and went back to 42. I'm baffled Returned it.
customer_reviews.author: Gary - Michigan

customer_reviews.title: Works Great in my area
customer_reviews.text: Awesome solution for me, I live in Denton Tx. The broadcast towers are a bit over 80 miles south, a set south of Dallas and a set in the Fort Worth area. I am now able to receive all the broadcast stations available with this antenna. I do use a Channel Master Ultra Mini 8 8-port signal distribution amplifier. I have an antenna wire that includes a ground wire attached to the antenna and the distribution amplifier. Much better than my previous solutions.
customer_reviews.author: RetiredRoadWarrior

customer_reviews.title: Excellent! I live in a disadvantaged area from a ...
customer_reviews.text: Excellent! I live in a disadvantaged area from a signal strength perspective. My house is 45 miles from TV towers, is at low altitude relative to the TV towers, and shielded by a thick trees (I am in the woods). this antenna allowed me to receive TV despite my location challenges. It is light weight. It was easy to assemble. I mounted it to a 6 foot high pole in the ground. I highly recommend this antenna for disadvantaged locations.
customer_reviews.author: 2007pony

customer_reviews.title: The best HD TV antenna for pulling in weak signals
customer_reviews.text: High gain antenna for HD TV reception. My antenna is installed in the attic and we live in a wooded area with poor visibility to the transmitters. This antenna is the only one I could find that would pull in these weak signals. This cost more than many antennas but you won’t find a better antenna for overall performance. I highly recommend
customer_reviews.author: Mike in Texas

customer_reviews.title: WOW, what a picture!!!
customer_reviews.text: I've used Channel Master products for years. This one is the best yet. I'm 60-70 miles from the transmitters (on flat ground) and now have the sharpest picture I've ever seen. Don't hesitate to buy this antenna, Channel Master ships quickly, it's very easy to install and the performance is incredible! 9/14/19 : I've recommended this antenna 3 more times since I purchased mine. Everyone has been happy with the reception!
customer_reviews.author: High Hat

customer_reviews.title: Got a real metal antenna, results as I expected. Perfect
customer_reviews.text: Way better than those plastic weirdo antennas. Look I mean antennas are supposed to be made out of metal not plastic. I threw away that one that looks like a figure 8 this one pulls in every station perfectly.
customer_reviews.author: A Reviewer

customer_reviews.title: Big, Great Reception, holds up to wind better than expected.
customer_reviews.text: Worried about having such a LARGE antenna so close to a lake where the wind is strong.But I have not had problems with twisting or bending. RECEPTION has been excellent! I live between 40 and 50 miles from towers that broadcast local stations and they are not all in the same location. I constantly forget that I am receiving off the air TV and not cable. Where I live there is no cable or internet so I have to use off air. Easily fit on old pole for antenna bent up by hurricane. I did purchase new Cat 6 cable and new connectors. Do Not have a Booster of filter.
customer_reviews.author: M1

customer_reviews.title: A good antenna for the right situations
customer_reviews.text: This was the 4th antenna I tried in my cable-cutting project. I like it because of its size and profile, but it was simply inadequate to pick up 2 VHF channels in my area. Its quality seemed average; nothing special, and I am sure it would last as well as the many others on the market. The lower rating is simply because it did not work, but it will really depend on your situation. I did end up with a Channel Master, YAGI-style antenna, and am pleased with its performance.
customer_reviews.author: Jim

customer_reviews.title: Great Antenna and customer service
customer_reviews.text: Channel Master CM-4221 UHF and HDTV Antenna combined with Channel Master CM-0500 JOINtenna TV Antenna Combiner and Mohu Leaf 50 Indoor HDTV Antenna for VHF. My home is about 40 miles from tower and almost every channel comes in perfectly. I got help form customer service to find the correct place to put the antenna even with a metal roof.
customer_reviews.author: BT

customer_reviews.title: Huge antenna, great reception even through obstacles
customer_reviews.text: While I'm not located very far from my local broadcast tower, approximately 22 miles, I don't have a great line of sight. This antenna basically looks right through my roof, and then my neighbors house from where I have it mounted inside my attic. Reception is fantastic. Excellent signal strength on all channels. I may have to add a signal booster after I split the feed off to other televisions, but that is to be expected.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good no-frills antenna
customer_reviews.text: Channelmaster has an incredibly helpful website and a good feel for the Terrestrial TV space. I started on their website, was quickly able to figure out what I needed and how to do it, then bought the gear and installed it. I don't even point the antenna directly at the stations and I still get the most channels (all of which come in nice and clear for my suburban location).
customer_reviews.author: Bryce S

customer_reviews.title: Worked behind a few mountains when others didn’t.
customer_reviews.text: Easiest to assemble, got a great picture and we are right behind some large hills/mountains in Phoenix about 17 miles as a crow flies to the tv towers. Mounted on ten foot pole on roof. Three other antennas failed or got a couple channels. This gets us all channels. Also it’s already assembled upon delivery making it as easy as it gets. This was a good purchase.
customer_reviews.author: peder442

customer_reviews.title: Close, but not close enough.
customer_reviews.text: I’m 45 miles NW of Chicago. Picked up around 35 channels (some very good, some not so good). Could not get a good enough picture on CBS, NBC, ABC, WGN, WTTW, FOX. I tried using it in my attic with a Winguard amplifier. I wound up with an Omni directional ClearStream 4Max. It was nearly twice the price, but the ClearStream clearly outperformed the Channel Master and gave me the primary stations of my interest. The Channel Master may work better outdoors if it were pointed more precisely to the towers? The Channel Master appears to be a very good weather resistant antenna.
customer_reviews.author: JD

customer_reviews.title: great antenna
customer_reviews.text: I mounted this antennae in my attic and it works great. I went from a flat black TV antennae behind each TV to this. I went from having about 10 stations to about 55!! Amazing reception even without a booster box. :) Very happy! I simply used a drywall screw to mount it to a stud in my attic. Very easy to install.
customer_reviews.author: RBG

customer_reviews.title: Not good VHF
customer_reviews.text: The first one came damaged. Reordered another one. Doesn't work any better than the little $39 RCA antenna. Sent that one back, hope I get my money back, I've got $300 in useless antennas.
customer_reviews.author: Goober

customer_reviews.title: Excellent picture quality
customer_reviews.text: This is the fourth different antenna i have tried on my house. I wish i would have bought this one first. All the other antennas had spotty coverage on the VHF channel bands (channels 10 and under in my area). It is far larger that my previous ones but i am sure that is what makes the difference. I would recommend to anyone who has tried smaller antennas with poor results.
customer_reviews.author: Patricia Stranak

customer_reviews.title: Works well
customer_reviews.text: Very light weight and flimsy, but actually well made. Works great with a channel master rotater and a Winegard pre-amp. Went from 3 channels to 19! Very happy with the result.
customer_reviews.author: O Town Eddie

customer_reviews.title: Get it.
customer_reviews.text: This thing was bigger than I expected. I barely got it in the access hole to my attic. With the antenna alone, I pulled in great reception. The website said I was only going to pull in 19 channels for our location and that's exactly what we pulled in. I don't even have it mounted. I just layed it against a rafter pointing it in the direction the website says to point. I get practically full signal on all channels except 1 where I get 3-4. This past weekend was a huge snow storm. Guess what? No interference at all! Get this antenna.
customer_reviews.author: Curtis Staveahl

customer_reviews.title: Antena did not arrive, UPDATE channel master responded quickly
customer_reviews.text: Ordered two items from channel master only one arrived. UPDATE channel master responded quickly to my inquiry stating the antenna sometimes ships separately, even though both were on the same shipping invoice. SO at the end of the day both products arrived quickly from channel master.
customer_reviews.author: John S.

customer_reviews.title: What you need to be a cable=cutter.
customer_reviews.text: We have been cable-cutters for about a year now thanks to this product. Super easy to use, but we did have a little trouble finding someone to install this on top of our house, and hook up to our 4 tv's. Once we found an electrician to do it, it was goodbye to cable. We get about 50 channels from locally to almost 75 miles away, and they come in great. We had it grounded, and have had no problems through many thunderstorms. We still use our tivo to tape programs and watch later, and all our same remotes. Just no cable bills or cable equipment! We have saved a ton of money with this product.
customer_reviews.author: kaycee

customer_reviews.title: This Antenna Will Save You Much Money.....
customer_reviews.text: WOW! So easy to assemble and install. Picks up 21 channels while far from any large cities. Anything else I need, I stream through my flat-screen from my computer. You should really consider the sizable savings you will experience when you cut the cord from cable and you actually lose nothing if you buy a $40 Firestick and become an Amazon Prime member. You will be covered better than you ever were.
customer_reviews.author: Sum Ting Wong

customer_reviews.title: Channel Master EXTREMEtenna 80 Mile Range
customer_reviews.text: I first bought a cheaper amplified antenna (PingBingDing) that would not pick up my local ABC affiliate that is about 60 miles away. I have many large oak trees in my neighborhood that obstruct the line of sight, so I decided to try the Channel Master. I set it up on the same mast as the other antenna, and it works great! I get all of my local channels, including my ABC affiliate and a few extra channels that I didn't even know existed. No amplifier needed! I highly recommend the Channel Master EXTREMEtenna!
customer_reviews.author: Path Straight

customer_reviews.title: Do your research - start with low expectations
customer_reviews.text: I mounted this thing up on an Antenna Mast about ten feet above my house pointing toward the TV stations. Despite the claim of 100 mile range I was only able to get stations 50 miles out and could not get a VHF station that was 25 miles out. I had high expectations but was disappointed. Do not rely on getting signals for VHF as it is not designed for it. Great if you are close to town. Note: Most stations no longer use VHF.
customer_reviews.author: Benjamin Shumaker

customer_reviews.title: added 20 channels over the small powered flat antenna's.
customer_reviews.text: put this in the attic and instantly had more channels. Then added a splitter to hook all the house outlets up with  Had even more channels. Highly recommend this over the powered stick on or smaller USB powered ones I was trying locally on each TV. this setup would have saved me $$ and added 20 channels.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Mount it as high as you can, I’m pulling in stations from about 60 miles. Works well for me.
customer_reviews.text: Replaces an older, traditional type antenna. Using it with a channel master amp. I have four TVs, it works fine. I’d have to say maybe a little better than my old style antenna that suffered hurricane damage. I think it would make a good attic antenna. The TV transmitters are all clustered together about 60 miles away, in my instance.
customer_reviews.author: mrp

customer_reviews.title: Brilliant!
customer_reviews.text: East Windsor Ontario. I'm getting 30+ channels with at least half broadcast in crystal clear HD. A HUGE improvement in sound quality over what's being broadcast on cable too. I've also ordered the terra DVR for a couple of reasons. #1 it appears OTA TVGOS is no longer broadcast......so no guide info is available without some kind of equipment and channelmaster guide is apparently very good. #2 I hate watching commercials. My time is WAY to important to me. #3 Channelmaster apparently streams content too but I can't find much information on what they stream. I'll update this review once installed.
customer_reviews.author: Abbott

customer_reviews.title: Doubled the amount of channels I was getting
customer_reviews.text: This pulled in over 25 channels when my old antenna had 12. My house had an old satellite antenna dish on the roof with coax cable already ran to the living room. I removed the dish and attached this to the mount. I then connected the existing coax cable. I ran the channel setup on the tv and ended up with so many more channels, most in HD. No monthly cost, nothing negative to say. I'm in Florida with a lot of hurricanes and windy rain storms. This has held up well to the rain and wind so far.
customer_reviews.author: RoBroKnos

customer_reviews.title: Good choice if you're dealing with broadcasters in two cities
customer_reviews.text: Where we live, we have stations at 302 degrees and 51 miles, and stations at 335 degrees and 18 miles (many thanks antennaweb.org). I needed all of them on one antenna, sans rotor, because we only watch TV from DVRs. Mounted this guy at about 30 feet high and pointed straight at 302 degrees. It is doing the job, with all four major networks coming in at a stable signal strength of 62+ on a Tivo Roamio.
customer_reviews.author: Ben Stein

customer_reviews.title: Great antenna!
customer_reviews.text: I installed this antenna at my camp, which is in a heavily wooded area. As the crow flies, I'm about 40 miles from the broadcasting stations. Installing this antenna was simple, and it works great! I'm getting all of the 22 DTV channels in my area. I installed a splitter and am running my garage tv off of this antenna also. No noticeable loss of signal. Others around me bought cheaper antennas made in china and now regret not getting the one I purchased from Channel Master! Totally satisified!
customer_reviews.author: Daniel L.

customer_reviews.title: Better than expected.
customer_reviews.text: Excellent reception. I'm in a canyon so reception is difficult at best but this antenna works well and I get over 60 channels, all with a great picture. I installed the antenna inside my garage as near to the roof as possible. Updated after 1-1/2 years of use. Flawless with well over 65 channels most of which are HD. I couldn't ask for better performance. Very well constructed and extremely easy to assemble and install.
customer_reviews.author: Scoundrel

customer_reviews.title: My wife wasn't too sure I had make a good choice on an antenna
customer_reviews.text: My wife wasn't too sure I had make a good choice on an antenna, considering the fact that we are around 75 miles from most of the stations. She was made a believer when I had it laying on the ground attached to a pole when she turned on the TV and had great reception, and I had not even put the pole up yet. She then was convinced I knew what I was doing when I purchased it. We didn't even need all the other stuff I had purchased with it to get better reception.
customer_reviews.author: D. Turpin

customer_reviews.title: Great Antenna
customer_reviews.text: This is a great medium range directional antenna. Small size and easy to install. Channel Master customer service is tops too. When I expressed to them that I would like more range, they issued credit without any problem. I replaced it w/CM-5020 long range antenna.
customer_reviews.author: 12pardh

customer_reviews.title: Recommended but disapointed
customer_reviews.text: Did not receive many channels, about 6 to 10. purchased an amplifier with no change in reception. installed new antenna cable and again, no change with reception. went back to 8x11 inch window antenna and get 20 channels??? was really excited about this antenna but it just didn't work the way I expected or should....
customer_reviews.author: Janet L. Lopez

customer_reviews.title: Killer antenna
customer_reviews.text: Nice nice antenna have a big old school style antenna thats 3 years old and this thing blows it away . I pull stations in about 70 plus miles away and I live in kentucky its not flat lol. Only thing I added was best coax cable and a 4 port booster to get signal to 4 tv's and it is great .
customer_reviews.author: Anthony ppool

customer_reviews.title: Best UHF Antenna on the market!
customer_reviews.text: I already had a 4 bay Channel Master UHF antenna. I received all Fort Myers /Naples channels but 7 low power stations from Fort Myers. I have this antenna about 3 foot above my chimney on a 2 story house with a Winegard amplifier. The new 8 Bay picked up the additional 7 channels and channel 20 no longer goes in and out. This antenna is running 3 tv sets. I am picking up a few channels from Tampa at nights. I am sure stacking 2 of these excellent antennas for long distance would be quite successful. I am more than satisfied. I highly recommend the superb Channel Master 8 bay antenna.
customer_reviews.author: Mark Roberge

customer_reviews.title: Great Antenna
customer_reviews.text: Works great. After trying to get an "antenna " co. to install an antenna and hearing every excuse in the book as to why an antenna may not work my husband bought this antenna plus the associated hardware and installed himself. Mind you he is a mechanical guy.
customer_reviews.author: Grandma7

product_meta.title: Channel Master EXTREMEtenna Long Range Multi-Directional Outdoor TV Antenna - 80 Mile Range - Preassembled - Install on Rooftop or Attic | CM-4228HD
product_meta.description: Size:80 Miles| Style:CM-4228HDThe Channel Master CM-4228HD EXTREMEtenna is an 8-Bay, phased array, multi-directional outdoor TV antenna that receives high definition and digital signals over-the-air from a span of 180 degrees. This antenna has a reception range of up to 80 miles. It has a compact design and comes preassembled to help make installation quick and easy.
feature_bullets: Enjoy the Most Popular HDTV Channels and Your Favorite TV Shows for Free with no Subscription Fees
Supports Uncompressed 1080i HDTV Broadcasts for the Highest Quality Video and Audio Available (Better than Cable & Satellite)
Multi-Directional (180 Degree Reception Span) with 80+ Mile Range
Compact Size Allows for Easy Installation on Roof, Chimney, Eave, Wall, Attic, Balcony, etc.
Comes Preassembled with Mounting Hardware and an Installation Guide [Note: Mast and Coaxial Cable Sold Separately]

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.5 out of 5 stars1,454 ratings4.5 out of 5 stars
